def enter_songs(songs_csv)
      songs_csv.each do |song_csv|
        song = Song.find_or_create_by_track_name_and_artist_name(
          :song_name => song[0],
          :artist_name => song[1]
        )
        song_entries.find_or_create_by_song_id(
          :song_id => song.id
        )
      end
    end

class User
    
    has_many :song_entries
    has_many :songs, :through => :song_entries

    def enter_songs(songs_csv)
      songs_csv.each do |song_csv|
        Song.find_or_create_by_track_name_and_artist_name(
          :song_name => song[0],
          :artist_name => song[1]
        ).tap do |song|
          song_entries.find_or_create_by_song_id(
            :song_id => song.id
          )
        end
      end
    end
  
  end

  class SongEntry
    belongs_to :user
    belongs_to :song
  end

  class Song
  end

def create
  @user = User.new(:user => params[:user])
  if @user.save
    redirect_to @user
    User.delay.get_data(params[:user][:url])
  else
    render 'new'
  end
end

def populate(songs)
        song = Song.find_or_create_by_track_and_artist_and_artworkUrl( 
                 :track      => songs[:track],
                 :artist     => songs[:artist],
                 :artworkUrl => songs[:artwork]
                )
                SongEntries.find_or_create_by_song_id(
                  :user_id => self.id,
                  :song_id => song.id)
    end
"Models in Rails use a singular name, and their corresponding database tables use a plural name. For the model to hold comments, the convention is to use the name Comment"
